Key Match Events: West Indies defeated Papua New Guinea by five wickets in the second match of the T20 World Cup 2024 played at Guyana's Providence stadium.
Rovman Powell's side chased the target in 19 overs on the back of a sixth-wicket stand between Roston Chase and Andre Russell.
West Indies had a jitter in the run chase as they lost five wickets for 97 runs and needed 40 off the last four overs.
Roston Chase kept his nerves and steered the home side to a win with a not out 27-ball 42.
Andre Russell supported with a nine-ball 15*.
Brandon King scored a 29-ball 34 while Nicholas Pooran made a 27-ball 27.
Skipper Assad Vala took two wickets for PNG by giving away 28 runs.
West Indies restricted PNG to 136-8 after opting to bowl first.
Sese Bau and Charles Amini had a notable partnership for PNG, scoring 44 runs for the fifth wicket.
Sese Bau scored a brilliant 43-ball 50 with the help of a six and half a dozen fours.
Skipper Assad Vala made a 22-ball 21 with the help of two fours and a six.
Kiplin Doriga chipped in with some vital runs at the backend to take the total to 136/8.
Andre Russell was the pick of the bowlers, bagging figures of 2/19 while Alzarri Joseph took 2/34.
Akeal Hosein, Romario Shepherd, and Gudakesh Motie took a wicket apiece.
